title: Lowe’s Stock Falls on Downgrade, but Analyst Says Things Will Get Better
text:
Lowe’s stock (ticker: LOW) is lower on Tuesday, following a downgrade from Raymond James, which thinks the home-improvement retailer will see impressive growth—just not as quickly as some hope.

The back story. Lowe’s shares are up 16.5% year to date, not far behind the S&P 500, but it’s been a bit of wild ride for shareholders: The stock was outperforming the broader market and rival Home Depot (HD) until May, when disappointing earnings sapped its momentum.
